Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Key observations: 1. Community Group Impact: Cases C001 and C004 both have community group affiliation (Highland Civic Darts Club) and received +10 point adjustments during PreliminaryScoring. Cases C002, C003, and C005 with None for community group received 0 adjustment.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: 2. Local Resident Status: All cases except C003 have LocalResident = TRUE. C003 has LocalResident = FALSE and was rejected despite having a score of 715 (which is higher than C004s 690 before adjustment, and similar to others).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 3. Approval Patterns: - C001: Approved (720 adjusted, community group, local resident) - C002: Approved (720, no community group, local resident) - C003: Rejected (715, no community group, NOT local resident) - C004: Approved (700 adjusted, community group, local resident) - C005: Approved (740, no community group, NOT local resident)

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait, let me look more carefully: - C005 is NOT local resident (FALSE) and was Approved - C003 is NOT local resident (FALSE) and was Rejected So its not just about local resident status. Let me look at scores:

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: - C003: 715 - Rejected - C004: 700 (adjusted from 690) - Approved - C005: 740 - Approved The threshold for approval seems to be around 700.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key discriminator appears to be community group affiliation. While C003 has a decent score, its lack of community group connection seems to be a critical factor in rejection. Conversely, C004s 700 score with a community group led to approval, suggesting a potential systemic bias favoring group-connected applicants.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This pattern indicates the scoring system might have an embedded bias that privileges applicants with specific community group memberships, potentially marginalizing independent applicants with comparable or slightly lower scores.
